title: Muskogee’s Local Hero
sub_head: Sixth-grader has a busy day rescuing neighbors.
body:
These days you might think that any story involving a school board meeting and social media is definitely not going to end well. But this story is about a day last week and a student who was not just good but very close to perfect when his neighbors in Muskogee, Okla., needed him most.
In the Enid News & Eagle, Cathy Spaulding reports on Tuesday’s meeting of the Muskogee Board of Education, when a number of local officials took the opportunity to honor sixth-grader Davyon Johnson for the remarkable events of last Thursday.
